comments.author: dimante@dimante.net
comments.creator: dimante@dimante.net
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.2) Gecko/20060308 Firefox/1.5.0.2
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.2) Gecko/20060308 Firefox/1.5.0.2

When viwing web pages with changing graphics example MRTG graph pages a constant Shift+F5 must be done to see the graphics change...  Even if the browser is closed and reopened..  This seems to be a cache refresh problem.  If you set the cache space to 0MB and go to about:cache it still caches seemingly disregarding the setting.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open a web page with changing graphical data
2.Close browser
3.Reopen browser and go to the same url

When viwing web pages with changing graphics example MRTG graph pages a constant Shift+F5 must be done to see the graphics change...  Even if the browser is closed and reopened..  This seems to be a cache refresh problem.  If you set the cache space to 0MB and go to about:cache it still caches seemingly disregarding the setting.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:

2.Close browser
3.Reopen browser and go to the same url

comments.raw_text: Reporter, do you still see this problem with the latest Firefox 2? If not, can you please close this bug as WORKSFORME. Thanks!
